alice.tuprologx.ide

Interface TheoryEditArea

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JavaEditArea

    interface TheoryEditArea
    An interface to an edit area for Prolog theories.
    This interface is not public, since it is intended for internal use, and could be subject to several changes in future releases.
    Version:
    1.0 - 13-nov-02
    Author:
    Giulio Piancastelli

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getCaretLine()
      Get the line number corresponding to the caret's current position.
      java.lang.String getTheory()
      Get the displayed theory as a java.lang.String.
      boolean isDirty()
      Check if the theory in the edit area has been modified after the last Set Theory operation.
      void redoAction()
      Redo last action in the edit area.
      void setCaretLine(int caretLine)
      Set the line number corresponding to the caret's current position.
      void setDirty(boolean flag)
      Set the dirty flag for the theory contained in the edit area.

      Display a theory in the edit area.

      Undo last action in the edit area.

    • Method Detail

      • setTheory

        void setTheory(java.lang.String theory)
        Display a theory in the edit area.
        Parameters:
        theory - The theory to be displayed in the edit area.

        java.lang.String getTheory()
        Get the displayed theory as a java.lang.String.

        the displayed theory as a java.lang.String.

        Set the line number corresponding to the caret's current position.

      • getCaretLine

        int getCaretLine()
        Get the line number corresponding to the caret's current position.
        Returns:
        the line number corresponding to the caret's current position.

      • setDirty

        void setDirty(boolean flag)
        Set the dirty flag for the theory contained in the edit area.
        Parameters:
        flag - true if the theory has been modified after the last Set Theory operation, false otherwise.

      • isDirty

        boolean isDirty()
        Check if the theory in the edit area has been modified after the last Set Theory operation.
        Returns:
        true if the theory has been modified after the last Set Theory operation, false otherwise.

      • undoAction

        void undoAction()
        Undo last action in the edit area.

        void redoAction()
        Redo last action in the edit area.
